New Records: Jalen Green and Fred VanVleet had 21 points each, which is a notable scoring performance
Key Match Events: The Rockets built a huge lead early and coasted to a 127-100 win over the Spurs
The Rockets were up by 25 points by halftime
The Rockets were up by 27 points when coach Ime Udoka cleared the bench with about 6½ minutes remaining
Pre-Game Insights: The Spurs were playing a third consecutive game without coach Gregg Popovich, who is out indefinitely while recovering from an illness
The Spurs were missing top on-ball defender Jeremy Sochan, who suffered a fractured left thumb that will require surgery
Post-Match Reflections: The Rockets finally put together a complete game against the Spurs after failing to play consistently for four quarters in the last two games
VanVleet had 10 assists and seven rebounds — both season-highs — to go with his top scoring effort of the season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets dominated inside, outscoring the Spurs 66-46 in the paint
The Spurs lost a second straight game and are playing without their top on-ball defender
The Rockets won for the fourth time in five games
Others: Victor Wembanyama had 15 points, six rebounds and three blocks for the Spurs
Rookie Stephon Castle will need to step up with Sochan likely out for an extended period
